snippet: Items from shuttered or renovated churches in the Archdiocese of New York were once sold, lost or given away, but now they are kept in hopes of using them elsewhere.
abstract: The Appraisal column; items from shuttered or renovated churches in the Archdiocese of New York were once sold, lost or given away; perhaps unknown to those mourning the passing of a beloved church, much of what was inside, from statues to votive stands and chandeliers, has been sorted and stored in a Staten Island warehouse, waiting for new homes in other Catholic parishes.
lead_paragraph: Items from shuttered or renovated churches in the Archdiocese of New York were once sold, lost or given away, but now they are kept in hopes of using them elsewhere.

headline.main: For Artifacts From Closed Churches, an Afterlife on Staten Island
headline.print_headline: For Artifacts From Closed Churches, an Afterlife on Staten Island

keywords.value: Mission of the Immaculate Virgin (Staten Island, NY)
